/index.ts(1,23): error TS2497: This module can only be referenced with ECMAScript imports/exports by turning on the 'allowSyntheticDefaultImports' flag and referencing its default export.
/index.ts(3,16): error TS2671: Cannot augment module './test' because it resolves to a non-module entity.
/index.ts(11,10): error TS2749: 'Abcde' refers to a value, but is being used as a type here. Did you mean 'typeof Abcde'?
/test.js(3,3): error TS2564: Property 'x' has no initializer and is not definitely assigned in the constructor.
/test.js(6,1): error TS1203: Export assignment cannot be used when targeting ECMAScript modules. Consider using 'export default' or another module format instead.


==== /test.js (2 errors) ====
    class Abcde {
      /** @type {string} */
      x;
      ~
!!! error TS2564: Property 'x' has no initializer and is not definitely assigned in the constructor.
    }
    
    module.exports = {
    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      Abcde
    ~~~~~~~
    };
    ~
!!! error TS1203: Export assignment cannot be used when targeting ECMAScript modules. Consider using 'export default' or another module format instead.
    
==== /index.ts (3 errors) ====
    import { Abcde } from "./test";
                          ~~~~~~~~
!!! error TS2497: This module can only be referenced with ECMAScript imports/exports by turning on the 'allowSyntheticDefaultImports' flag and referencing its default export.
    
    declare module "./test" {
                   ~~~~~~~~
!!! error TS2671: Cannot augment module './test' because it resolves to a non-module entity.
      interface Abcde { b: string }
    }
    
    new Abcde().x;
    
    // Bug: the type meaning from /test.js does not
    // propagate through the object literal export.
    const x: Abcde = { b: "" };
             ~~~~~
!!! error TS2749: 'Abcde' refers to a value, but is being used as a type here. Did you mean 'typeof Abcde'?
